== New Features in Lubuntu 14.10 ==

* General bug fix release as we prepare for LXQt.
* Many LXDE components have been updated with bug fix releases.
* An update of the artwork (more icons, theme update, more compatibilities ...).
 
=== Lubuntu Applications ===

* Based on the lightweight <nowiki>[[http://lxde.org/ | LXDE desktop environment]]</nowiki>.
* <nowiki>[[http://wiki.lxde.org/en/PCManFM | Pcmanfm]]</nowiki>, a fast and lightweight files manager using gio/gvfs.
* <nowiki>[[http://openbox.org/ | Openbox]]</nowiki>, the fast and extensible, default windows-manager of LXDE.
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/lightdm | Lightdm]]</nowiki>, using the simple GTK greeter
* Firefox, the famous web browser.
* For more detail, please see the <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Lubuntu/Setup#Applications | full list of applications]]</nowiki>.

=== System Requirements ===

Lubuntu is a good operating system for many old computers, but not for all of them. Some computers have too little horsepower or memory. A rule of thumb is that the computer should not be more than 10 years old.

'''Memory (RAM)'''

For advanced internet services like Google+, Youtube, Google Docs and Facebook, your computer needs at least '''1 GB RAM'''.

For local programs like Libre Office and simple browsing habits, your computer needs at least '''512 MB RAM'''.

'''Processor (CPU)'''

The minimum specification for CPU is Pentium 4 or Pentium M or AMD K8.

Older processors are too slow and AMD K7 has problems with flash video.

'''Graphics chip / card'''

Nvidia, AMD/ATI/Radeon and Intel work out of the box, or the system can be tweaked to work fairly easily. You can get help at the <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org|Ubuntu Forums]]</nowiki>. With such graphics, or if you don't know, try the current Lubuntu version.

== Known Issues ==

=== Installation ===

* The i386 Desktop image is slightly oversized and will need to be burnt to a DVD or USB.
* Encrypted install fails, though there is a workaround (<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/ubiquity/+bug/1205397 | 1205397]]</nowiki>).

=== Graphics and Display ===

* Pager preferences crashes, but a workaround exists (<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/obconf/+bug/1272834 | 1272834]]</nowiki>).
* Power manager is hard to see (<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/lxpanel/+bug/1334088 | 1334088]]</nowiki>).
* Horizontal bars on notification dialog; workaround exists (<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xfce4-notifyd/+bug/1362555 | 1362555]]</nowiki>).

=== PPC ===

* Due to several bugs, including a showstopper for those with Radeon graphics (<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/1377878 | 1377878]]</nowiki>), there will be no ppc release for this version.
* We recommend using one of the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/LTS | LTS]]</nowiki> versions.

=== Ubuntu Release notes ===
 
* For issues and features common to Ubuntu, please refer to the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UtopicUnicorn/ReleaseNotes | Ubuntu release notes]]</nowiki>.

=== Get Lubuntu ===

Head over <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Lubuntu/GetLubuntu | here]]</nowiki> to get it.
